abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Eastern Nile
            Planning Model Project for Eastern Africa is that countries
            in the Eastern Nile adopt an improved decision support
            modeling framework to identify water-related investments and
            evaluate them in a regional context. There are three
            components to the project, the first component being
            knowledge base development. The knowledge base developed
            will provide a shared, synoptic view of the Eastern Nile
            basins, including its opportunities and risks as viewed from
            an economic, environmental and social perspective.  Baseline
            data will be organized systematically in a Geographic
            Information System (GIS) platform with an associated web
            portal. Effective use will be made of modern datasets from
            satellite remote sensing and other global or regional
            datasets. The second component is the modeling system. The
            models will build on a water systems 'spine' using
            tools developed by the Nile Basin Decision Support System
            (DSS) to help analyze the economic, environmental and social
            aspects of investments in a water resources systems
            framework and to evaluate alternative scenarios of the
            future.  The tools developed will draw upon and contribute
            to the knowledge base developed and will be flexible to
            adapt to changing needs and increasing information
            availability. Finally, the third component is the
            institutional and human capacity building.
